did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center.

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondance, pamphlets, and alumni records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Gala '88 playhouse drawings, Gala '88 videotape (VHS), and the 1988 GMU holiday card from President and Mrs. Johnson. The Arts Gala is an annual GMU event held since 1981 to benefit the university. Former GMU President George Johnson and his wife, Joanne, were particularly interested in the event and promoting the arts in general at GMU.

Boxes 1-3, 10 and 11 contain items related to the Arts Gala. Boxes 4 and 5 contain primarily correspondence from 1980 - 2008, as well as financial reports, handbooks, membership forms, and membership information. Boxes 6 and 7 contain alumni records from 1972 - 2007. Boxes 8 and 9 contain newletters and pamphlets, respectively

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Development and Alumni Affairs records must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accessioned by the Special Collections Research Center between 7/24/1984 and 6/13/2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Development and Alumni Affairs records, R0012, Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.
